data.title: Christmas Eve Service
data.text: A few years ago we began a new family tradition by attending Christmas Eve service at FBC Knoxville. Normally a one hour long service, typically begins around 5:00pm, which leaves time to do family dinner that evening. Suggest visiting the downtown city Christmas lights afterward. We normally sit in the upstairs balcony, it helps us experience the candles from an omniscient view point.

data.title: a beautiful and well-preserved church in the heart of downtown
data.text: I am impressed at the condition of the First Baptist Church.  It is well-maintained and lovely, both inside and out.  Wonderful acoustics aid in the enjoyment of music, if you are lucky enough to visit while music is being played.

data.title: A lovely visit each time in Knoxville
data.text: Wonderful congregation, lovely dedication to music, very much a must visit each time one visits, several weekly gatherings. Beautiful sanctuary, friendly members, very helpful, and always available to visitors. Charming and inviting. Do visit!!!

data.title: Historic Church
data.text: Love old churches and was in the area, so I knew I had to stop. the sanctuary is quite lovely indeed. this is a solid piece of historic architecture.

data.title: A beautiful sanctuary and very friendly members
data.text: This church has been in the downtown area for many decades, so the architecture is historically impressive both inside and out. The sanctuary is very inviting and gives you a warm feeling when entering. The parking is limited in the front, so you need to know the bank parking garage next door is available free of charge every Sunday. If you are in the area over any weekend, it is well worth the visit.

data.title: Beautiful historic church
data.text:
Built in 1924 this peaceful church is listed on the National Registry of Historic places. 
The architecture strikes a chord of awe both inside the sanctuary and the surrounding grounds. Located in central downtown Knoxville, this is the very nice place to step inside and view  a piece of the city's history while having a quiet moment of reflection.
